entity1.name: spiders
entity1.description: A class of arachnids characterized by their eight legs and ability to produce silk.

entity2.name: webs
entity2.description: Complex, sticky structures created by spiders using silk for catching prey and other purposes.

entity3.name: spider
entity3.description: A small arachnid that constructs webs for hunting and protection.

entity4.name: web-building
entity4.description: The process by which spiders create their webs using silk produced from their bodies.

entity5.name: spinnerets
entity5.description: Specialized glands located at the rear of a spider's abdomen used for producing silk.

entity6.name: abdomen
entity6.description: The posterior section of a spider's body, containing vital organs and structures such as spinnerets.

entity7.name: spiders
entity7.description: A class of arachnids that produce silk, known for their ability to create intricate webs and the unique properties of their silk.

entity8.name: silk
entity8.description: A natural protein fiber produced by spiders and other insects, characterized by its strength and elasticity.

entity9.name: Spiders
entity9.description: A class of arachnids characterized by their ability to produce silk and having eight legs.

entity10.name: Silk
entity10.description: A fine, strong, soft thread produced by spiders and some insects, used for various purposes including web construction and egg sac creation.
